Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 13:22 - We can now confirm that all power in the Link Road should be back on. The issue was due to faulty piece of network equipment, however engineers have managed to restore power from the substation nearby and will be investigating the equipment further.

Additional work may be required in order to permanently fix the fault.

To do this safely, your power may go off again later as repairs progress. If there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles. 

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 12:47 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to a faulty piece of equipment on our underground network which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Link Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 15:30-16:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Simon at 12:17.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 19:29 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 00:30-01:30 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.

Sent by Luke at 20:13 - An overhead cable has come down in the area in dense woodland and bog. Our engineers are ensuring sure everything is safe before they access and assess the situation. Due to this we are now aiming to restore power between 22:30 and 23:30. Thank you for your patience.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Luke at 19:33 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 23 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 97 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Sent by Luke at 20:13 - An overhead cable has come down in the area in dense woodland and bog. Our engineers are ensuring sure everything is safe before they access and assess the situation. Due to this we are now aiming to restore power between 22:30 and 23:30. Thank you for your patience.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support.

Sent by Luke at 19:33 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 23 properties still affected.

They have managed to get a further 97 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised.

If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on.

To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV OH Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 03-FEB-2026 22:30.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have confirmed that a cable has been damaged in the Pines area. They are now about to begin excavating down to the cabling, so they can then make a cut on it which will allow them to isolate the damaged section away from the main network.

At this stage the estimated time frame doesn't need to change but its possible this may need to be adjusted depending on how their excavations progress. I'll continue to keep you updated with their progress but if you have any further questions, don't hesitate to call us free on 105. Sent by Will at 20:49
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Roland at 19:31.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 17:43. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 19:56 - Our engineers have restored power to all 2245 properties in the Seaford, BN25 3 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around the underground network fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Seaford, BN25 3 area to investigate the power cut affecting 609 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Luke at 19:31.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 18:36. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 04:36 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs to a fault on the underground network in the Knights Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified four poles that need upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the poles. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Avidety will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. Please turn over for useful information. This work is taking place along Leighton Road. Please note there will be multi way traffic lights will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 20:20 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Chamberlain Avenue area, the estimated time of 23:30 and 00:30 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Luke at 19:56.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs replacing and upgrading. We also need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off, and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Lewes Road.

Our staff have now arrived on site in the Union Street East area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we need to connect a new secondary substation to the electricity network. This equipment controls and delivers electricity into your area and will enable new customers to be connected to our electricity network. To connect the new equipment and complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off. Once completed this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in your area and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place on land off Station Road.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 03:30 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repaired a fault on the underground network in the Danson Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage and how long you were off for. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 01:32 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Danson Road area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Theo at 00:44.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 2 cables and 10 poles that need upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by an unplanned power cut in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place along Head Hill Road. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided. Please turn over for useful information.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 18:56 - We can now confirm that all power in the Leveller Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 18:22 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Engineers have arrived on site to investigate what we believe to be an issue at the local substation in the Leveller Road area. Using an average timescale for this type of issue, we're looking to have you back on between 21:30 and 22:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but for more information about this type of fault; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Luke at 17:38.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Luke at 16:29 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1665 customers in the Street area, by diverting power around the high voltage fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:00 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 16:00-17:00 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on an underground electricity cable affecting the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.

Sent by David at 12:00 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 16:00-17:00 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.

Sent by David at 11:03 - Hi David here again. Our engineers have just advised us that they are now estimating to have power restored between 16:00 and 17:00 due to a lot of work still to do to dig down and locate the faulty underground electrical equipment before they can work to restore the power the Broadoaks Way area.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified two poles that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the poles. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Our contactors will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place on Hall Road.
